main event: A single steady white light, about 1/2 the brightness of a second-magnitude star, was observed moving from southwest to northeast over the horizon in Blacksburg, Virginia.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 10 minutes, moving in a straight line across the horizon.
The object's brightness and speed did not change during the observation.
The observer was Lt. Col. Theodore M. Fite, a rated command pilot in the U.S. Air Force.
The report mentions the object was likely the satellite 'ECHO II', which was visible in the sky at the time.
The report was submitted to the Foreign Technical Division at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base.
witnesses: Lt. Col. Theodore M. Fite, USAF
